alert.note: Alert for Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 9:59PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Zapata County through 1100 PM CDT... At 958 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of El Cenizo, or 15 miles north of San Ygnacio, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Ygnacio. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 738 and 758. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
